thread.title: PGA Tour returns to Las Vegas for the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open
thread.title_full: PGA Tour returns to Las Vegas for the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open

title: PGA Tour returns to Las Vegas for the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open
text: Share Updated: 12:29 pm LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) -- For the 33rd consecutive year, top golfers from across the world will be at TPC Summerlin, shooting for the title at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open. The FedEx Cup event is the only PGA Tour stop in Las Vegas. The main goal of the tournament is to raise funds in support of Shriners Hospitals. The hospitals have locations throughout the United States, which provide advanced care for children with orthopedic conditions, burns, spinal cord injuries and cleft lips and palates. The Shriners Hospitals have been the fundraiser for the Las Vegas PGA Tour stop since 2008. Tickets can be purchased as day-passes for $30, or week-passes for $100 at the Shriners Hospitals Open website . Kids under 18, active or retire military and first responders (firefighters, police officers, EMTs) are free.
